poem:
Title: "Unearthly: A Ballet in Blue"

In cold depths, the most daring peal,
A solitary Dutchman finds his zeal,
Breathing ice, absorbing chill,
Chasing spectres of ill will.

Through Hof's paradoxical dance,
Invites a peculiar kind of trance,
Of frost and fire intertwined,
A liminal peace of body and mind.

Yet caution flits in silent flight,
In shadow-lands of frosty delight,
In the pursuit of ice-man's story,
Lies the risk, within the glory.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. A new study suggests they may indeed reduce levels of inflammation in the body. However, experts stress that practising the Wim Hof method is not without risk. Hof is a Dutch athlete, best". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
